metadata.Title: CVE-2018-9518 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In nfc_llcp_build_sdreq_tlv of llcp_commands.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID: A-73083945. It was discovered that a buffer overflow existed in the NFC Logical Link Control Protocol (llcp) implementation in the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-34-generic - 4.15.0-34.37
